quest.name: Magiteknical Difficulties
journal: Slafborn has a seemingly urgent message for you.

Slafborn informs you an acquaintance of Cid awaits your arrival within the workshop. He warns you, however, that her disposition is anything but cordial. Speak with Slafborn once more to enter the workshop, then see what business this visitor has brought.

You enter the workshop to find Jessie, deputy president of Garlond Ironworks, waiting for you, though she makes it clear that her current title was thrust upon her in Cid's absence. She explains that a recent drop in productivity has left them scrambling to make ends meet, and asks to see your magitek armor in the hopes of drawing inspiration for a new product.

While at first taken aback by the sleek design of your suit, she is inevitably disappointed by the damaged weaponry. Unable to bear seeing good steel go to waste, she insists you gather parts so that she may begin repairs immediately. Make your way to Castrum Centri and retrieve a magitek converter #49, magitek oscillator #50, and magitek cannon barrel #51 from the Empire's storage crates.
You have collected the parts needed to restore your magitek armor. Hurry back to Cid's workshop and deliver them to Jessie.

Jessie is pleased to see you have located the required parts, and restores the magitek armor to the best of her abilities. Though the weapons are now functional, she warns you that they are not quite suitable for combat.
objectives: Retrieve a magitek converter #49 from the storage crates in Castrum Centri.
Retrieve a magitek oscillator #50 from the storage crates in Castrum Centri.
Retrieve a magitek cannon barrel #51 from the storage crates in Castrum Centri.
Deliver the magitek parts to Jessie.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. You've come at just the right time. A visitor is waiting for you in the workshop. A friend of Cid, it seems.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Realizing your preoccupation with other matters of import, I suggested she wait at the Seventh Heaven until your arrival, but she refuses to leave. I fear you have a very brash client on your hands, friend.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to Cid's workshop?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Are you ready to go inside? I fear waiting will only make her more irritable.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: I must confess, it's been quite some time since I've encountered someone quite so boorish. I would suggest you see to her business as quickly as possible, lest her presence hinder business in the workshop.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: So you're MissMister Surname, eh? Took you long enough. The name's Jessie, deputy president of Garlond Ironworks.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Don't look too impressed, now. In truth, I'm nothing more than an engineer, but thanks to you filling Master Garlond's head with them damfool ideas of heroism and saving the realm, there's no one else around to fill his golden breeches.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: We've been busting our collective arses on these orders from Highwind Skyways, and are still only scraping by. The real problem is, with Master Garlond gone, productivity's dropped like the knickers on a Stonesthrow strumpet. The company'll be in deep if something ain't done.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: And that's why I'm here. Sure, our machinists have made their fair share of chronometers and plasma lamps, but we need something grand─something that'll have clients on their knees literally begging us to take all their sparkling gil.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: I want you to show me the magitek armor you borrowed from our friends the Garleans. Yes, yes, I know all about your little foray into the Praetorium. You can thank Biggs and Wedge for that.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: I reckon there's a lot we can learn from that reaper, and after all you've done to distract Master Garlond, I'd say you owe us that much and more.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: This is amazing! Do you even know what you have here? Listen to that ceruleum engine. I've never heard anything so sweet!

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: And the servomechanism should be... Wait! A mammet core!? Why didn't I think of that!? They're so easy to come by, mass production would be as easy as stealing candy from a baby...or cores from a mammet.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: But what in the seven bloody hells have you done to the cannon's poor convergence modulator!? Burnt it out firing victory rounds after slaying some family of rabid squirrels, no doubt. It's a wonder the whole suit isn't a steaming pile of molten slag. Such a waste...

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: What in the Builder's name are you looking at? You need something to fix your prying eyes on, try the wall.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I can't bear to see such a fine piece of work in such a sorry state. I'll patch her up as best I can, but you'll need to gather the parts needed for the job. Think of it as one of them adventures you seem so keen on.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: A make #49 magitek converter and a make #50 magitek oscillator should do the trick. Oh, and a magitek cannon barrel, make...er...#51. I can't guarantee she'll be good as new, but at the very least she'll be in better shape than she's in now...which still ain't saying much.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text:
Eyes on me, Forename. I ain't done with you yet. That is, unless you know whereabouts one might stumble across a spare converter, oscillator, and cannon barrel. No? Didn't think so. So here's a hint─it rhymes with Castrum Centri.
You see, Garlean-made technology is what we're after, and I can't think of a better place to find some. Off with you now!

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: You lonely, or just poor with numbers? I'm assuming the latter, so listen up. We need a magitek converter #49, a magitek oscillator #50, and a magitek cannon barrel #51. You might want to write that down, unless it is you're poor with letters, to boot.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Now off to Castrum Centri with you. And no stopping to sniff the sunflowers. It breaks my heart every second I have to think about that armor in such sorry shape.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Welcome back. Still attending to business in the workshop?

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Let me guess. You've lost...no, broken...no, traded for magical beans the parts we need.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Well, color me mildly impressed. I was half expecting the worst, and got...well, less than the worst.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Don't get all giddy on me, now. You're still not off the hook for stealing away Master Garlond. But I'll admit, I'm beginning to see why he might feel the need to latch himself onto an adventurer like he might a stray pup. Alright, let's see if I can't salvage this mess of a masterpiece.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Phew, I think that's it. Both magitek and photon cannons should be functional.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: That said, I'm no Garlean. There's no third eye hidden up under these lovely locks, and there's a great deal I don't know about their machina. I can't guarantee the cannons won't misfire, but then again, misfire is better than no fire, eh? Even so, I wouldn't recommend using the weaponry in actual battle.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Speaking of fire, it's high time I got back to the Ironworks. Patching up those cannons has given me a few ideas. You take good care of that armor, or you'll have me to answer to, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your magitek armor's magitek and photon cannons are now operational. They can be accessed via the Pet Hotbar when riding your mount. However, please note that these weapons do not employ lethal force, and will have no effect in combat.
